channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Claudia Lawrence: Mum in 'utter shock' at new search
item.description: Joan Lawrence says "every single day is a nightmare" since her daughter disappeared in 2009.

item.title: Covid infection protection waning in double jabbed
item.description: Experts say it is to be expected and boosters may be needed, at least for some people, ahead of winter.

item.title: Covid: Cornwall tourists urged to 'stay away' as cases rise
item.description: Visit Cornwall says only people who have booked should visit as cases nearly double in a week.

item.title: DJ to hold Ministry of Sound fundraiser for twin brother in Covid coma
item.description: The twin of a DJ who fell into a coma after catching Covid is holding a club night to raise money for his care.

item.title: Just Eat announces 1,500 new jobs in North East
item.description: The food delivery platform will invest Â£100m to create 1,500 new customer service roles.

item.title: The Smithy Family: Police release image of car in arson inquiry
item.description: The Smithy Family's London home caught fire after their car was set alight.

item.title: 'Tom Cruise is in my Warwickshire garden'
item.description: A request to land a helicopter carrying an unnamed VIP leads to an encounter with Hollywood royalty.

item.title: Two-year-old dies in fire at Ingoldmells caravan park
item.description: The child's mother and three siblings escaped the blaze in Ingoldmells, Lincolnshire Police say.

item.title: M25: Three dead and two arrested after lorry, minibus and car crash
item.description: A fourth person is in hospital after the crash involving a lorry, minibus and car near Waltham Abbey.

item.title: Cygnet Appletree: Mental health hospital 'did not protect patients'
item.description: The care watchdog took "urgent action" after finding a "toxic" culture at Cygnet Appletree.

item.title: Rare Jane Austen sketch loaned to Bath
item.description: The sketch by her sister is the only widely accepted portrait of the writer who lived in Bath.

item.title: Consultation begins on beaver reintroductions
item.description: The UK government is seeking people's views on whether beavers should return to England's rivers.

item.title: How the world's oldest hat shop made it through lockdown
item.description: Lock & Co was first established in 1676 and has sold hats to the likes of Nelson and Winston Churchill.

item.title: Mission: Impossible train crashes into quarry in Stoney Middleton
item.description: Local photographers said the film's star Tom Cruise had been at the quarry to witness the crash.

item.title: Solihull friends' lockdown boredom turns horse box into pizzeria
item.description: Enterprising teenagers oversee the conversion to launch a mobile food business.

item.title: Ferrybridge chimney stacks demolished in controlled explosion
item.description: The controlled explosion takes place at a former coal-fired power station in West Yorkshire.

item.title: 'Race should not be a factor in my destiny'
item.description: A young Londoner beats 23,000 other entrants in one of the country's largest anti-racism competitions.

item.title: Carabao Cup: Barrow 0-6 Aston Villa - Cameron Archer hits hat-trick as Villa cruise into third round
item.description: Teenager Cameron Archer scores a hat-trick as Aston Villa ease into the third round of the Carabao Cup by thrashing Barrow.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Sarah Storey wins 15th Paralympic gold
item.description: Britain's Sarah Storey wins her 15th Paralympic title for Britain's first gold medal at the Tokyo Games.

item.title: Premier League clubs will not release players for international games in red-list countries
item.description: The Premier League says its clubs have "reluctantly but unanimously" decided not to release players for matches in red-list countries during September's international break.

item.title: T20 Blast: Sussex beat Yorkshire to reach Finals Day
item.description: Sussex beat Yorkshire by five wickets at the Emirates Riverside in the first T20 Blast quarter-final.
